channel.title: Grownups Read Things They Wrote as Kids
channel.description: Remembering the good, the bad, and the awkward parts of growing up. Since 2007.

item.title: 424: "You can't moose hunt for a living" (Toronto)
item.description: Trevor fights Dracula, Peggy writes for her friend’s zine, Ryan is valedictorian for the class of ‘96, and much more. Recorded live at the Hot Docs Podcast Festival in Toronto.
item.itunes:summary:
Trevor fights Dracula, Peggy writes for her friend’s zine, Ryan is valedictorian for the class of ‘96, and much more. Recorded live at the Hot Docs Podcast Festival in Toronto.

Episode notes

  • Shows mentioned:
    • Red Man Laughing
    • Now or Never - CBC Radio
    • The Nod - Gimlet Media
  • Support GRTTWaK. Become a patron.
  • Photos from our Toronto event
  • Music by Podington Bear and Lullatone
  • Closing theme is “Oh Dear Diary” by Sloan
item.content:encoded:
Trevor fights Dracula, Peggy writes for her friend’s zine, Ryan is valedictorian for the class of ‘96, and much more. Recorded live at the Hot Docs Podcast Festival in Toronto.

item.title: 407: "Love is like a terrifying blanket" (Toronto)
item.description: Frances writes love letters to a stranger, Tish vists planet Grammar, Matthew buys a discount turkey burger, and much more. Recorded live at the Tranzac in Toronto.
item.itunes:summary:
Frances writes love letters to a stranger, Tish vists planet Grammar, Matthew buys a discount turkey burger, and much more. Recorded live at the Tranzac in Toronto.

Sponsor

This episode is brought to you by the CAMH One Brave Night for Mental Health challenge. On April 7, people across Canada will share one night to inspire hope for the 1 in 5 Canadians living with mental illness in any given year. You can step up and stay up to defeat mental illness. Visit onebravenight.ca/grownups to register now.

Show notes

  • Support GRTTWaK. Become a patron.
  • Photos from our Toronto event
  • Music by Podington Bear and Lullatone
  • Closing theme is “Oh Dear Diary” by Sloan

item.title: 306: "Virginity is like a birthday cake" (Calgary)
item.description: Terra compares virginity to a birthday cake, Bradley explains how to find a rock, Mary plans to “bump off” a nun, and much more. Recorded live at Yuk Yuk’s in Calgary, AB.
item.itunes:summary:
Terra compares virginity to a birthday cake, Bradley explains how to find a rock, Mary plans to “bump off” a nun, and much more. Recorded live at Yuk Yuk’s in Calgary, AB.

Grownups Without Borders

We’re looking for childhood and teenage writing that has travelled long distances. If you wrote something as a kid, and someone else far away has it, reach out to them. Try to get a copy. And if you have something that someone else wrote as a kid, dig it up, so we can surprise them.

Then, send me an email. If we get enough of this stuff, we’ll put together a special episode, reconnecting people and places through juvenilia.

Terra compares virginity to a birthday cake, Bradley explains how to find a rock, Mary plans to “bump off” a nun, and much more. Recorded live at Yuk Yuk’s in Calgary, AB.

Show notes

  • Photos from our Calgary event
item.content:encoded:
Terra compares virginity to a birthday cake, Bradley explains how to find a rock, Mary plans to “bump off” a nun, and much more. Recorded live at Yuk Yuk’s in Calgary, AB.

Grownups Without Borders

We’re looking for childhood and teenage writing that has travelled long distances. If you wrote something as a kid, and someone else far away has it, reach out to them. Try to get a copy. And if you have something that someone else wrote as a kid, dig it up, so we can surprise them.

Then, send me an email. If we get enough of this stuff, we’ll put together a special episode, reconnecting people and places through juvenilia.

Terra compares virginity to a birthday cake, Bradley explains how to find a rock, Mary plans to “bump off” a nun, and much more. Recorded live at Yuk Yuk’s in Calgary, AB.
